TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs class is used to supply event values to the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule.Creating> event and to enable you to specify a custom Windows identity for the current request. You can access the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule.Creating> event of the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule> class by specifying a subroutine named **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** in the Global.asax file for your ASP.NET application.
The <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule> constructs a AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs object using the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> and passes it to the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs.AnonymousID%2A> property of the AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs object supplied to the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event to set the anonymous identifier to a custom value. If you do not specify a value for the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs.AnonymousID%2A> property during the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event, a <xref:System.Guid> is used.
The **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event is only raised when the anonymous identification is <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule.Enabled%2A>.
## Examples The following code example uses the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event to set the anonymous identifier to a custom value.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.security.an_1_1.asax)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.security.an_1_1.asax)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule> constructs a <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs> object using the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext>. It then passes the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs> object to the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the anonymous identifier for the user.
Docs.value: The anonymous identifier for the user.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the AnonymousID property to set the anonymous identifier to a custom value during the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event. If you do not specify a value for the AnonymousID property during the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event, a <xref:System.Guid> is used.
The **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event is only raised when the anonymous identification is <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule.Enabled%2A>.
## Examples The following code example uses the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event to set the anonymous identifier to a custom value.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.security.an_1.asax)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.security.an_1.asax)]

Docs.summary: Gets the object for the current HTTP request.
Docs.value: The object for the current HTTP request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> provides access to <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Request%2A>, <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Response%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> objects for the current request.
